thread.title_full: BAIT BUDDY Invented by InventHelp Client (QCY-114) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: BAIT BUDDY Invented by InventHelp Client (QCY-114)
text:
InventHelp, based in Pennsylvania, is submitting this idea, BAIT BUDDY, to companies for their review and potential feedback.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 24, 2015
“I enjoy fishing from the pier, but many times my bait would dry out, blow away or get stolen by birds,” said an inventor, from Charlotte, N.C. “I thought there needed to be a way to protect live bait, so I invented this.” He invented the patent-pending BAIT BUDDY.
The BAIT BUDDY provides an effective way to store and protect live bait. In doing so, it prevents bait from being stolen by birds. It also enhances bait storage and organization. The invention features a portable, waterproof design that is convenient and easy to use so it is ideal for fishing enthusiasts. Additionally, the BAIT BUDDY is producible in design variations and a prototype is available.
The inventor described the invention design. “My design offers a convenient and protective storage solution for live bait.”
The original design was submitted to the Charlotte office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-QCY-114, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
